newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: Disease kills five in Bangladesh flood areas.
newsitem.headline: Disease kills five in Bangladesh flood areas.

text.p: Diarrhoeal diseases have killed at least five people and afflicted over 1,000 in Bangladesh's flood-swept southeastern districts, health officials said on Wednesday.

Disease broke out as floodwaters receded in most of the stricken districts. "We are battling a spreading diarrhoeal disease. Efforts to contain it are being intensified," one official in Chittagong said. He said the deaths were reported from Bandarban district in the Chittagong Hill Tracts. More than 100 people died in landslides, collapsing houses and by drowning in the floods, which were set off by heavy rains.
Communications with some districts were still cut off after the deluge washed away bridges and roads.
